page.title: 10HOME LIFE IN FRILSHAM
page.content: Life in the area is quiet and leisurely and this is reflected in the homes of people living here. The{large {houses}are gracious and well kept with beautiful gardens. At the other end of the scale are{small cottages}mainly attached to farms. There is no poverty here. In 1948 a{council estate}of 30 houses, Beechfield, was built. They are attractive houses with large well cared for gardens. There are also some old people's bungalows. Many tenants have been there since 1948- two are buying their homes. There is no gas in the village.{Lighting, heating and {cooking}are fuelled by electricity. Some houses are warmed by solid fuel or by oil. There is{mains water and {sewage. Refuse}is collected weekly from Newbury.{Milk}is delivered every other day.{Letters}are delivered twice daily. There is no shop.
